intro: Hederella quintuplinervis, commonly known as the five-veined ivy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves with five distinct veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are followed by berries that turn red when mature. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Hederella quintuplinervis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions.
